p: We infer that P. guyannensis and P. cuvieri diverged in the Pliocene, around 5.03 million years ago (Mya), with 95% confidence of Highest Posterior Density Interval (HPDI) ranging between 3.8–6.2 Mya. The diversification of the clades found in the eastern portion of the Guiana region occurred in late Pliocene, at around 2.85 Mya (95% HPDI: 1.9–3.8 Mya) in P. guyannensis and more recently in early Pleistocene in P. cuvieri, at 2.19 Mya (95% HPDI: 1.4–3.1 Mya).
